text: Tereza Vanišová (born 30 January 1996) is a Czech ice hockey player for the Czech national team.2019 IIHF Women's World Championship roster She was drafted 12th overall by the Boston Pride in the 2020 NWHL Draft. == Career == Across 129 NCAA games, Vanisova put up 129 points. She was named Hockey East Co-Rookie of the Year and Czech Republic's Female Hockey Player of the Year in 2016-17. The next year she would be named a WHEA Second Team All- Star.https://goblackbears.com/sports/womens-ice-hockey/roster/tereza-vani- ov-/5001 She is currently the University of Maine's all-time leading scorer.http://hockeyeastonline.com/women/articles/2019/12/grant-mentis-and- vanisova-named-co-players-of-the-month.php She has been noted for her quick and creative playing style.https://www.pensionplanpuppets.com/2019/4/3/18289567/2019-iihf-womens- world-championships-group-b-japan-germany-damkronorna-sweden-bleues-france- czech === International === She participated at the 2016 IIHF Women's World Championship, as well as the 2017 and 2019 World Champhionships.2016 World Championship rosterhttps://www.si.com/nhl/2017/03/31/womens-world- championship-preview-team-breakdown She had previously represented the Czech Republic at the 2012, 2013 and 2014 IIHF World Women's U18 Championships. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Czech women's ice hockey forwards Category:People from Strakonice Category:Czech expatriate ice hockey people Category:Czech expatriate sportspeople in Canada Category:Czech expatriate sportspeople in the United States Category:Maine Black Bears women's ice hockey players
title: Tereza Vanišová
